meanings.definition: A rope attached to the foot of a square sail to haul it up to the yard when furling.
meanings.sent1: The sailor pulled on the buntline to raise the sail.
meanings.sent2: The buntline helped lift the heavy sail effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: As the wind picked up, the buntline played a crucial role in securing the sail.
meanings.sent4: The buntline was like a loyal assistant, always ready to hoist the sail.
meanings.sent5: The buntline's job was to make sure the sail reached the top smoothly.
